agency_impact: The University of Hawai'i System provided testimony to the Senate Committee on Ways and Means in support of the measure (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_). The university reiterated that a single, system-wide fund would standardize conference center programs and eliminate duplicative statutes (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_). This structure would align with other successful University of Hawai'i funds (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_).
policy_impact: The Senate Committee on Ways and Means amended the measure and recommended that it pass Third Reading as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2 (HB1169_SD2). The committee's amendments clarified the permissible uses of moneys appropriated from the consolidated university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund (HB1169_SD2). These changes are intended to facilitate the administration of conference center funds and standardize programs across all campuses (HB1169_SD2).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The measure has advanced through the Senate Committee on Ways and Means, which recommended its passage as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 2 (HB1169_SD2). A key amendment was made to clarify the permissible uses of moneys from the new revolving fund (HB1169_SD2). The University of Hawaiâ€˜i System provided new testimony reiterating its support for the bill's intent to standardize conference center administration (HB1169_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_).
